author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Swine Fever in Spain, Olympic Flame Handover, and Restoration of the Pergamon Museum

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A B.C. legislator is proposing a new statutory holiday to commemorate the 2022 Freedom Convoy, which would coincide with the day provincial COVID-19 public health restrictions were lifted. Tara Armstrong, one of two MLAs to form the OneBC Party, introduced the Freedom Convoy Recognition Act on Dec. 2. March 11 would become a statutory holiday if […]
title: BC Legislator Introduces Bill to Make a Freedom Convoy Statutory Holiday

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney is planning to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump at a FIFA World Cup event Friday in Washington as trade negotiations between Canada and the United States remain on pause. The Prime Minister’s Office said Carney will meet with Trump at the Kennedy Center, where the event is being held, and […]
title: Carney to Meet Trump, Sheinbaum in Washington at FIFA Event Friday

author: Rachel Roberts
description: A self-described 'king' of the notorious 400 Mawozo gang, Joly Germine orchestrated the kidnappings from a Haitian jail, with the victims including 5 children.
title: Haitian Gang Boss Sentenced to Life for Masterminding Kidnap of Christian Missionaries

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The president celebrated the agreement, signed in the newly named Donald J. Trump Institute of Peace.
title: Trump Presides Over Peace Signing Between Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda

author: Jack Phillips
description: The bulletin was sent out as tensions between the United States and Venezuela have escalated in recent days.
title: US Embassy Renews Venezuela ‘Do Not Travel’ Advisory for Americans

author: Dorothy Li
description: The French president also sought to persuade the CCP to support a cease-fire in Ukraine.
title: Macron Urges Xi to Narrow ‘Unsustainable’ Trade Gap

author: The Canadian Press
description: More than 27,000 federal public servants were paid at least $150,000 in the last fiscal year, a document tabled in Parliament shows. It says more than 20,000 employees received compensation—salaries, bonuses, benefits and overtime pay—of between $150,000 and $199,999 in 2024-25. The document, prepared by the Treasury Board of Canada Secretariat, shows that nearly 5,000 […]
title: More Than 27,000 Public Servants Were Paid $150,000 or More Last Year

author: Chandra Philip
description: A new study has found differences in how men and women respond to stress, according to researchers from McGill University. The study, which included researchers from McGill University and Concordia University, found that women who reported high levels of stress show early signs of heart tissue changes associated with cardiovascular disease. Researchers said they did not […]
title: Canadian Study Highlights How Men and Women Respond to Stress Differently

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: John Rustad has resigned as leader of the B.C. Conservative Party in an announcement made Dec. 4 at the provincial legislature in Victoria. Rustad did not provide further details, confirming he will step down as leader but will stay on as an MLA. “I am announcing that I am stepping down as the leader of […]
title: John Rustad Resigns as Leader of BC Conservative Party

author: Andrew Moran
description: Wealth appreciation and inheritance were the key themes in the Swiss bank's study.
title: World’s Billionaire Population Surges to New Record High: UBS

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s food regulator is implementing new measures to control a salmonella outbreak linked to Iranian pistachios, as laboratory-confirmed instances of salmonella infections spread across six provinces. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) banned all imports of Iranian pistachios on Sept. 27, and is currently performing targeted testing on products that are already in Canada. The […]
title: CFIA Ramps Up Pistachio Screening With Mandatory Testing as Salmonella Cases Rise

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Quebec government will table a bill on Friday to ban vote-buying in political party leadership races. The legislation comes following allegations that some party members who voted for Quebec Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez during a leadership race earlier this year could have received cash rewards. Élections Québec later revealed that the province’s Elections Act […]
title: Quebec Government to Table Bill Banning Vote-Buying in Leadership Races

author: PA Media
description: The family of Novichok victim Dawn Sturgess have said “there must be reflection and change” as they criticised the lack of recommendations in a public inquiry’s final report. Relatives of the 44-year-old, who died after being exposed to the nerve agent in Amesbury, Wiltshire, in 2018, said it is a “matter for real concern” that […]
title: Novichok Victim’s Family Call for Change as They Criticise Inquiry Report

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump participates in a peace agreement signing ceremony with the presidents of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo at 12 p.m. ET on Dec. 4.
title: LIVE NOW: Trump Participates in Peace Deal Signing Ceremony With Presidents of Rwanda, Democratic Republic of Congo

author: PA Media
description: Downing Street has rejected suggestions Sir Keir Starmer is acting like a “dictator” amid a row over the Government’s move to postpone four mayoral elections. Number 10 said plans to push the votes – originally due next year – back to 2028 would allow more time for reorganisation of local authorities under its devolution agenda. […]
title: Number 10 Rejects ‘Dictator’ Claims Amid Row Over Mayoral Election Delay

author: PA Media
description: The UK and Norway have signed a defence pact that will see their navies operate a combined fleet of warships to hunt Russian submarines. The deal, which the Government said was the “first of its kind”, is aimed at protecting critical undersea cables, which the UK and its Nato allies believe are under increasing threat […]
title: UK and Norway Sign Defence Pact to Hunt Russian Submarines

author: PA Media
description: A man has been charged with assisting Manchester synagogue attacker Jihad Al-Shamie with earlier reconnaissance on a UK defence facility. On Thursday, the Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) announced Mohammad Bashir, 31, had been charged with four terrorism offences. A spokesman said the assistance allegedly provided by Bashir was not in relation to the attack on […]
title: Man Charged With Assisting Synagogue Attacker on Earlier Reconnaissance

author: PA Media
description: The number of people in hospital with flu in England is at a record level for this time of year, as health officials warned the NHS is bracing itself for an “unprecedent wave” of infections. An average of 1,717 flu patients were in beds in England each day last week, including 69 in critical care, […]
title: Number of Flu Patients in Hospital at Record Level for Time of Year

author: PA Media
description: The Liberal Democrats have asked the Education Secretary to “seriously consider” mandating CCTV in nurseries in response to the case of paedophile nursery worker Vincent Chan. Speaking in the Commons on Thursday, Liberal Democrats education spokesperson Munira Wilson said CCTV had been “vital” in getting convictions in a similar case in her Twickenham constituency and […]
title: Phillipson Asked to Consider Mandating CCTV in Nurseries After Paedophile Case

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Military activity and tensions between Israel and Lebanon have persisted despite a 2024 cease-fire agreement.
title: Lebanese PM Says Normalization With Israel Far Off Despite New Dialogue Channel

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The average family of four in Canada is expected to pay an additional $994.63 for food in 2026 compared to the previous year, according to a new report, with overall grocery prices expected to increase by 4 to 6 percent. The 2026 edition of Canada’s Food Price Report considered several factors when forecasting price increases, […]
title: Canadian Families Will Pay $995 More for Food in 2026: Food Price Report

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada will need to pay $16 million to participate in a defence procurement agreement with the European Union, officials say. Canada officially joined the $244 billion Security Action for Europe (SAFE) program this week. The program is a component of the ReArm Europe strategy aimed at reducing the continent’s dependence on American defence technology and […]
title: Canada to Pay $16M to Enter EU Defence Pact

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Russian president's comments follow remarks by Trump describing U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff's meeting with Putin as 'reasonably good.'
title: Ukraine Peace Talks ‘Useful’ but Reaching Concensus ‘Difficult’: Putin

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The platform is also facing scrutiny in several states including Texas, where it is being sued for allegedly failing to protect minors from online predators.
title: Russia Blocks Gaming Platform Roblox Over Child Safety Concerns

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new poll says concerns about job stability and the economy are weighing on first-time homebuyers looking to enter the market. The Harris Poll Canada study commissioned by Scotiabank says more than half of Canadians planning to buy their first home in the next five years feel that doing so is currently out of reach. […]
title: Economy, Job Stability Concerns Delaying Some First-Time Home Purchases: Poll

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Multiple search operations for the plane have been carried out, but no trace of the main body of the plane or passengers has ever been found.
title: Search to Resume for Malaysian Flight MH370, 11 Years After Vanishing

description: Ukraine’s ambassador to the United States said the children must be returned or Kyiv will not agree to a peace deal with Moscow.

description: Following the return of the remains of Thai national Sudthisak Rinthalak, only one deceased hostage remains unreturned.

description: The alleged financial leader of Tren de Aragua was among those sanctioned by the Treasury Department.

description: The United State 'is taking decisive action in response to the mass killings and violence against Christians [in Nigeria],' Secretary of State Marco Rubio said.

description: A minister who said he was not involved in helping the ISIS-linked women and children return, is now under scrutiny after leaked documents show he was.

description: Authorities are believed to be searching for the boat they arrived on.
title: 6 Undocumented Chinese Arrivals Found Wandering Remote Western Australia

author: AAP
description: A former Australian soap star has been told to reach out to the Jewish community to apologise for performing a Nazi salute in public. Ex-Neighbours actor Damien Richardson, 56, was found guilty in November of intentionally performing the gesture while delivering a speech at a ticketed event. He attended Moorabbin Magistrates Court on Thursday for […]
title: Ex-TV Star Facing ‘Restorative Justice’ for Nazi Salute

author: Jacob Burg
description: Ukraine has said it is ‘non-negotiable’ that all kidnapped children must be returned before Kyiv accepts any peace deal with Moscow.
title: Senators Call on Designating Russia a Terrorist State Amid Allegations of Mass Child Kidnapping, Brainwashing

author: The Associated Press
description: LONDON—A rare crystal and diamond Fabergé egg crafted for Russia’s ruling family before it was toppled by revolution shattered records Tuesday as it sold at auction for 22.9 million pounds ($30.2 million). The Winter Egg, which was compared to the iconic Mona Lisa, was just one of seven of the opulent ovoids remaining in private […]
title: Crystal Fabergé Egg Crafted for Russian Royalty Shatters Record and Sells for $30.2 Million

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Jaan Shah Safi, who entered the U.S. under the prior administration, is nabbed in Virginia on suspicion of providing support for the ISIS terrorist group.
title: ICE Arrests Afghan Man Accused of Supporting ISIS

description: Jaan Shah Safi, who entered the U.S. under the prior administration, is nabbed in Virginia on suspicion of providing support for the ISIS terrorist group.

description: Australians with multiple sclerosis, rare cancers, and chronic immune disorders will see medicine costs fall.

description: Trump confirmed the call days prior, but declined to comment further on it.

description: U.S. President Donald Trump has endorsed conservative Nasry Asfura, who in the latest count has fallen behind by just over 14,000 votes.

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Around 68,000 public servants received letters this week informing them of eligibility for potential early retirement incentives, coming as Ottawa pushes to cut 30,000 positions from the public service in the next five years. Ottawa has already cut about 10,000 positions from the public service over this past year as part of wider expenditure savings […]
title: 68,000 Public Servants Receive Letters Offering Eligibility for Early Retirement Options

author: The Canadian Press
description: Conservative immigration critic Michelle Rempel-Garner said Wednesday it’s time for the federal government to end virtual citizenship ceremonies. The Conservatives campaigned on this idea during the spring election and Rempel Garner suggested it could be a way to help restore some confidence in the immigration system. “With support for immigration at an all-time low, returning […]
title: Virtual Citizenship Ceremonies Should End, Says Conservative Critic

author: Alfred Bui
description: The EV Council also stated that people can earn $1,500 a year with their EV and solar panels using the vehicle-to-grid technology.
title: EV Owners Can Recoup Purchase Costs in Under 10 Years, Inquiry Told

author: Chandra Philip
description: Two Calgary police officers are being thanked for their quick actions that saved the life of a 4-day-old infant in medical distress. The incident happened in the early hours of May 29 after Sarah and Alex noticed their newborn, Ollie, had suddenly became ill, according to a social media post by the Calgary Police Service. […]
title: Calgary Police Officers Help Save 4-Day-Old Baby in Medical Distress

author: Chandra Philip
description: The government of B.C. says it is introducing new gambling regulations to curb money laundering and fraud in the province. As part of the changes, a new gambling regulator, the Independent Gambling Control Office, will be introduced, according to a Dec. 2 government news release. The gaming control act, passed in the fall of 2022 […]
title: BC Says New Gambling Regulations Soon in Effect to Curb Money Laundering, Fraud

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The news comes as New Zealand announced its own funding package, saying the nations were 'working together' in a challenging environment.
title: Australia Deepens Military Backing for Ukraine With $95 Million Package

author: Olivia Gomm
description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is planning to place a more than $10 million rush order for 20 armoured vehicles from Canadian defence manufacturer Roshel. The agency has laid out plans for a rush order worth the equivalent of roughly CA$10 million for 20 Senator STANG emergency response tactical vehicles, according to U.S. government […]
title: ICE Plans to Order 20 Armoured Vehicles From Canadian Manufacturer Roshel

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: New stock assessments show key species, such as dhufish and pink snapper, are under threat and require government intervention.
title: Western Australia Shuts Down Fishing to Save Threatened Species

author: Bacchus Barua
description: Commentary Health-care reform is often considered the “third rail” of Canadian politics—a reference to an electrified line on train tracks best left untouched. However, a new survey suggests that the Canadian public is ready for reform, and it’s time for politicians to get on board. Provincial health-care systems are in crisis. We have a persistent […]
title: Canadians Are Ready for Health-Care Reform, and It’s Time for Politicians to Get on Board
